text: Croydon, an electoral district of the Legislative Assembly in the Australian state of New South Wales was created in 1927 and abolished in 1959. __NOTOC__ {| class="wikitable" |- ! !colspan="2"|Member!!Party |- | 1927 | rowspan="2" | | rowspan="5" |Bertram Stevens | rowspan="2" | |- | 1930 |- | 1932 | rowspan="3" | | rowspan="3" | |- | 1935 |- | 1938 |- | 1940 by | rowspan="2" | | rowspan="7" |David Hunter | rowspan="2" | |- | 1941 |- | 1944 | | | |- | 1947 | rowspan="4" | | rowspan="4" | |- | 1950 |- | 1953 |- | 1956 |} ==Election results== === Elections in the 1950s === ====1956==== ====1953==== ====1950==== ===Elections in the 1940s=== ====1947==== ====1944==== ====1941==== ====1940 by-election==== ===Elections in the 1930s=== ====1938==== ====1935==== ====1932==== ====1930==== ===Elections in the 1920s=== ====1927==== ==References== Category:New South Wales state electoral results by district
title: Electoral results for the district of Croydon (New South Wales)
